titleStmt.title: The Quakers unmasked, and clearly detected to be but the spawn of Romish frogs, Jesuites, and Franciscan fryers, sent from Rome to seduce the intoxicated giddy-headed English nation by an information taken upon oath in the city of Bristol, January 22, and some evident demonstrations / by William Prynne ...
titleStmt.author: Prynne, William, 1600-1669.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
